Package src

Class EventCalendar

java.lang.Object
src.EventCalendar
public class EventCalendar extends Object
Manipulates the event calendar through methods that add events, remove events, and sort events.
Author:
SebastianHanna

  • Constructor Details

    • EventCalendar

      public EventCalendar()
      Constructs the EventCalendar Object. Takes no arguments. Initializes the events array to an empty array and sets numEvents to 0.

  • Method Details

    • find

      private int find(Event event)
      This method finds out if an event is in the events array.
      Parameters:
      event - takes the event that is being searched for.
      Returns:
      int returns the index of the event if found. Returns -1 if the event is not in the array.

    • grow

      private void grow()
      Grows the length of the event calendar array by 4.

    • add

      public boolean add(Event event)
      Adds an event to the end of the event array.
      Parameters:
      event - The even you want to add to EventCalendar.
      Returns:
      boolean Returns true if event is successfully added.

    • remove

      public boolean remove(Event event)
      This method removes an event from the EventCalendar.
      Parameters:
      event - The Event that should be removed.
      Returns:
      boolean Returns true if event was successfully removed. Returns false if the event could not be found and removed.

    • contains

      public boolean contains(Event event)
      This method finds out whether or not an event is contained in the EventCalendar.
      Parameters:
      event - The event you want to see if EventCalendar contains.
      Returns:
      boolean Returns true is the event is contained in the EventCalendar array. Returns false if it is not.

    • print

      public void print()

    • swapEvents

      private void swapEvents(int index1, int index2)
      This method swaps two events in the EventCalendar array.
      Parameters:
      index1 - the index of the first Event object.
      index2 - the index of the second Event object.

    • printByDate

      public void printByDate()
      This method prints the array by date and timeslot.

      public void printByCampus()
      This method prints the array by campus.

      Retusn the number of events in the calendar.
